verb.description: Make (something, especially the skin) thoroughly clean.
examples: this preparation will cleanse and tighten the skin

noun.description: A process or period of time during which a person attempts to rid the body of substances regarded as toxic or unhealthy, typically by consuming only water or other liquids.
examples: you can consume the broth three times a day for a cleanse
I recommend doing a cleanse when your social calendar is event-free, because you might feel a bit more tired than usual

origin: Old English clǣnsian (verb), from clǣne (see clean).
